Reviews.Title: Foscam Cameras good value for casual use
Reviews.Author: E. COMER
Reviews.Content: Over the past year I have done a lot of work with network IP cameras including high-end commercial models from Axis Communications; mid-range units from Panasonic and budget cameras from Foscam. I have worked extensively with three Foscam camera models - FI8918W Pan/Tilt, FI8909W-NA fixed camera and the FI8904W fixed outdoor model. All of these cameras were purchased directly from China rather than from Amazon, because Amazon did not offer them when I made my purchases, however, Amazon's price is very good and I would purchase any future units from them.The Foscam cameras are made by Foscam Intelligent Technologies Co., Ltd. in Shenzhen, China. Their website is often down, apparently due to China's  pervasive interference with its Internet service. Despite this, Foscam's support via email is quite responsive considering the time difference.These cameras have proven reliable after months of service both indoors and outdoors. All of the camera models have been installed outdoors in semi-protected locations, such as under a building eve and the model FI8904W has weathered a less protected location where only the rear of the camera was shielded from rain. Note: only the front of the  FI8904W is water resistant, despite what the brochure says.These cameras are consumer grade with a small sensor and a plastic lens. Display resolution is modest at 640 x 480 Pixels (300k Pixels). They are adequate for general observation and surveillance and are especially good for monitoring a home interior. You can test drive a Foscam FI8918W camera installed in Russia at this link: […] Login using Server Push Mode as user  demo and a password of demo. You can fully control the pan/tilt. Personally, I recommend that you never use the ActiveX mode - it is, in my opinion, buggy.All of the Foscam cameras come with infrared LEDs built-in the camera face. This enables night vision in black & white. The  FI8904W model is particularly good at seeing in the dark, given its large array of infrared LEDs. The manufacturer claims 20 meters of visibility. I can say that a pitch black 20x20 foot room will appear as if the room lights are on in the FI8904W 's video.The builtin software enables multiple cameras to be linked through its built-in web page, creating a single monitoring center for multiple cameras. A demonstration of this feature can be seen on YouTube at:[…]One issue is that to save cost, Foscam cameras lack the switchable infrared filter found in more expensive IP network cameras. As a result, the colors of images and videos will not be true, primarily concerning the color green. Plant foliage will appear gray. Given the camera's security goal, this isn't a big issue to me.All Foscam cameras have built-in software supporting a motion detector feature that can be scheduled by day of week and time of day, in fifteen minute increments. When active, detected motion will cause six time stamped (in the filename) still photographs of what caused the motion to be emailed to the email address of your choice. It supports access to smtp mail servers, such as Yahoo but not SSL servers, such as Gmail.Lastly, configuring any network IP camera, not just Foscam, is not plug and play and Foscam's little  instruction booklet is minimal. Help exists on  Internet forums like […]

Reviews.Title: Great so far but wish it had some features
Reviews.Author: JayJay "Bovie Muff"
Reviews.Content: I've had it for about a week so far and bought it to really monitor my dog's behavior while I'm away.  The infrared beam is excellent especially now with the dark winters.  In fact the beam reaches pretty far and the picture at 640x480 looks very clear.I had a Compro IP60 stationary camera before and one thing I really liked about it was I could point my Blackberry to an RTSP address and it'll stream right to the phone (when it worked that is).  With the Foscam it seems I'm dependent on purchasing an IP camera program.  Two I saw in the app store cost $15 or more but I tested out Total Control which is $6 for a 4 camera version.  It seemed to work and has options to pan the camera but my experiences showed my camera just moving on its own with me having no control whatsoever, even connected via wi-fi on the same network.  Because of that I won't try to pan it at all since you'll just wind up staring at a wall.The audio is incredibly clear, although only available with IE, and with minimal lag.  The Compro IP60's audio has a lot of lag and there's a lot of clicking sounds, like relays going off inside, before and after which is pretty annoying so I was happy this didn't have any of that.I read a lot of reviews about this before getting it and I'll just say that if you're technically inclined and can read the words on the web GUI, you don't even really need any instructional book at all whatsoever.  I had the thing set up and going just by looking over all the settings.  It's actually all quite simple so jump right in.The other complaint people listed was ActiveX crashing a lot with Win7 64bit.  Mine crashed often too but one day when I had it in compatibility mode it seemed to work perfectly.  Today though it's crashing again.  Kind of sucks since it's so inconsistent.  Hopefully a web UI update will fix this soon.Currently I'm using a Synology DS409 with its Surveillance Station to record video but it doesn't fully support the 918 yet.  I can pan and tilt and all but there is no audio.Overall it's pretty nice.  I intend to buy a second one so I can monitor more areas in my condo.  The infrared beam only turns on when it gets dark so you don't have to worry about wasting energy.  Even in the night though you have the option of turning it off altogether.  All in all pretty nice but due to lack of HTTPS, and the fact I leave it on all the time, I don't port forward to it but instead use an SSH server to connect to and then tunnel to the camera.  Now all my data is encrypted with an incredibly complex passphrase.The one feature I wish it had was some sort of pan limit settings for the patrol.  It will scan side to side or up and down but all the way to the ends.  I wish it had numbers displayed for its pan location and somewhere you can enter in a min and max range.  I really don't need it to patrol the two walls I have, since it goes 300degrees, just down the two hallways.  It's like limiting sticks for a machine gunner position.  There's just a lot of wasted motion when it goes well beyond where it really needs to go.And yes, my dog is freaked out by it when it moves and I fear I'll have video of her attacking it some day but that'd be worth the $92.

Reviews.Title: NTS ( Not too shabby)
Reviews.Author: a_justice
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this product I was expecting a heap of crap I would just throw in the trash can. Day three of having it, I am pleasantly surprised. There are, although, a few stipulations to my 4 star review. I work in IT and have for quite awhile, that said, if you are not technically savvy, do not buy this. You will be lucky to get the installation cd to work correctly. After installation of the software I found that the start menu shortcuts and desktop shortcuts didn't even point to the product *.exe. This was an easy fix after searching for it. Once that was fixed I was quick to learn the OEM software doesn't even work ( for me, your experiences may differ. I am using Win7 x64). I quickly trashed the DVD, obtained the IP address of the camera (of which you must plug into your network through Ethernet cable first) from the DHCP client table on my home router and just visited the built in web server via chrome(the web site works with all major browsers, I have tried it on IE, chrome and fire fox). From this point it was easy. I quickly set it up on my wireless from the website. Skipping the technical details, once setup, I was quite pleased with the quality of video and all the feature that came OEM. If you are a technical person and able to throw some time to setting it up, I would recommend it. For the price, I wouldn't buy anything else.**A side note. I am not a fan of thieves. We recently had our vehicles broken into in the middle of the night. That said, my objective when buying this camera and basis of the review, revolves around the idea that I would be able to be better guarded against future thieves/ scum of the earth. I hope this helps for those of you in the same boat.Suggestions you might find helpful.---Router- Disable mac address filtering.- Assign a static IP to or reserve a DHCP IP for the camera.- If you want to access the camera remotely, forward an obscure port (ideally not 80 as most consumer plans block this)to the camera's IP. ( you must also make the proper changes on the camera for the port change)---Third party software- Make use of it. The VLC plug in does not work as it should. I spent a long time figuring out why I could not use the two way audio from the website. I just installed IP Cam Viewer on my phone and Ispy IP Camera Viewer on my laptop.- Recording works best from a third party solution. To my understanding recording with the OEM setup is done through active X in IE. If you as me this is a crappy solution and doesn't allow full use of the features.- As a rule of thumb, if you get frustrated with the OEM solutions, don't even bother.--- Remote viewing- Just break down and buy the dydns solution. It is built in and works well. It will save you from the frustration of trying to use a free solution. Plus it updates automatically when your outside IP changes.- Be aware of ISP port blocks. My ISP (like most) blocks port 80 (which is default for all HTTP and this camera). It is easy enough to change the port access on the camera, then forward all port X requests to that camera. Then of course if you have to take everything to far like me and don't want to type in website.com:X everytime, just setup a redirect from dydns. i.e. redirect requests to website.com to website.redirect.com:X. **Quick tip. Don't use cloaking when you redirect. This makes everything on the camera's website "undefined".Hope this helps for those of you who are on the fence. 4 solid stars and a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Do not be tricked into buying a Look Alike
Reviews.Author: Whatmorecanyousay "Bob"
Reviews.Content: There. are exact replicas of this unit on the market at less than 50 dollars.They Stink. Why? Not standard interface on board. Cannot transition to outsideinternet access. I know I am stuck with a local network only lookalike.The FOSCAM works and can be view like all the other cameras over the internet.The new android Operating system supports the camera with a free applicationthat brings all of your live cameras in view all at once. You can pick one Enlargeit on the Droid Screen for more detail. Works on 2G and Up phones. Does better withDual processor Smartphones.  I just upgraded and the frame rate increased in a 3Garea. Not 30fps not even 10 but you can see things moving. You might catch a birdin flight it stops and is not there on the next frame. A person Jerks across thescreen but is recognizable on the hand held. A full PC can capture everything.But hey you can still see the movement and its clear on the newer resolutionAndroid units. There is a bonus with this unit it has eyes, ears, and a voice.You can say thank you to the UPS person from 500 miles away and he thinks yourin the house. The voice is not so hot from a 1 inch speaker. The software forAndroid phones is available at the apps store. The best is free for testing butwhen you get to more than 1 camera the very best is IPCam by Robert Chou.He upgrades and takes in most camera specs so that you have only one tap and allof your cameras in different locations come up on the screen because all of the key strokesare put into the on board application for each camera and the camera mfg specs are alreadyin the application. You just need choose the make and model and put in your User ID and Passwordonce in the Android phone live. You tape the one you want to manipulate Pan and Tilt and other controlsto own the camera. Works over WiFi somewhat faster.Stick with the known brands for video capture. The control software is standardand the pan and tilt from a handheld is magic.whatmorecanyousay

Reviews.Title: Works Great, Fast Shipping
Reviews.Author: rjeii2 "rjeii2"
Reviews.Content: The product works as it should, installation was not to bad. Pan/Tilt works great (even has speed settings) and video quality is better than I expected even under NO light conditions.

Reviews.Title: Works Great for a Good Price
Reviews.Author: The Correlator
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the webcam so far (after a day)Easy to set up.  I'm accessing through a browser on Mac, so no ability to use the microphone/speaker - that's fine with me. Cool to be able pan and tilt the camera right from the browser, and the infrared night vision works great.Very capable product!

Reviews.Title: FI8908W now FI8918W
Reviews.Author: sojourner75
Reviews.Content: Just a heads-up that this camera has been replaced by the FI8918W and will ship as such.That said, after ordering thinking I would receive an 8908W and instead got an 8919W, Foscam was *extremely* quick to respond to resolve the situation.  They have pointed me to an Agasio unit that is identical to the 8908W that they carry as well and have made every effort to go the extra mile.In the IP Camera segment there do appear to be knock-offs / grey market sellers, but after this great customer service experience, along with a prior FI8910W camera purchase from them, I'm happy to recommend them as a seller on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Value!
Reviews.Author: dholanda
Reviews.Content: Camera is good.  It was a bit complicated to install it. Make sure that after you install the software on Windows 7 that you change the path for the desktop camera icon (it is on the instructions).  Also do not panic if the tilt controls do not appear on the software itself.  You need to upgrade the firmware on the camera and then upgrade the software user interface (also on the instructions.)  Great quality in low light. I was impressed with the speed you can tilt the camera.  Works on Iphone, Android.  There is a rubber coat around the body of the camera and base. Wall mount is a plus.  The manufacturer states that you can connect up to 9 cameras with the software, but since I only bought 1 unit I could not test it with multiple cameras.

Reviews.Title: Hardware is ok - Software is defective - Customer service only helps with easy questions
Reviews.Author: C. J. Vazquez
Reviews.Content: I have given this review a lot of thought. This was the first time I purchased a product like this and as you can see by the price they aren't cheap. Unfortunately even though the hardware is fine the software is incredibly faulty. A weak interface, overall unreliable, and the fact that it cannot read special characters makes it not worth the money. I tried to bring up these issues with customer service but even though they are quick to answer the easy questions, the hard ones go without a reply. Do not buy a Foscam camera. Save up for a more expensive, realiable brand.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera.
Reviews.Author: N. Tazeh "Sidney Tazeh"
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup, (I used 'no ip' for remote access), great image quality. A little bit on the pricy side. You can get two similar quality cameras for $120Camera tilt got stuck once when I moved locations. I had to gently pull both corners outward to 'release' the pivot.

Reviews.Title: Not User Friendly
Reviews.Author: Dax
Reviews.Content: If you're not an IT person, then you might want to hire someone to install it in order for you to use your Iphone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to configure -- up and working quickly
Reviews.Author: Kristi "all my facts come from fiction"
Reviews.Content: The thing I worried about most in this purchase was configuring... reading review of IP camera after IP camera, it sounded like one needs to be a network engineer to get the thing to work.  NOT the case with this camera -- I had it up and running wirelessly in less than half an hour (and I can't claim all my attention was devoted to camera installation during that period; it could be done more quickly if one weren't distracted, I'm sure!)  I configured it by the desk, but then decided to move it to a window to look at something interesting.  Held my breath a little when I plugged it back in -- could it really be this easy? -- but it still worked!  The camera does go into automatic panning once you turn it on/plug it in, and it does take about 60 seconds for the video to register at the controller software/network browser.Like most wireless devices that don't have keyboards or other methods to input wireless keys, you need to plug the camera into a wired network port to setup the wireless.  There are included printed Quick Installation Guides for both Mac and Windows OS,but I would recommend using the manual on the included CD -- it is SO much easier to read!The pan and tilt are just a hoot to use and the range of motion is quite extensive.  The camera control utility on the PC allows you to set the "patrol speed" as well as how far the camera pans and tilts while it is "patrolling" (or you can tell it to just be still!).  When I opened the box, my husband said "Oh, you bought the one without zoom."  Hm.  That was the first I realized I had done that -- there were so many features from which to choose, and I was trying to be budget-conscious.  However, while I can't zoom, the camera resolution is good, and I feel we can see both close and distance.  The color is also good.  The camera control menus are extensive and not always totally intuitive to use -- a "what is this?" function would have been really nice if you weren't going to actually include help.  However, there is that manual on the CD! Setting up email to get alerts would be next to impossible without the manual, but is quite easy with it.To use the audio, I had to download a free utility (link is provided on the camera control menu).  Audio fidelity is not the most fabulous -- if you were using this to record anything critical, well, I wouldn't.  However, I am confident it will be fine for our purposes.I'll update this review when we've had a chance to try the "night vision," and motion detection.  It's interesting that the motion detection seems to come with a scheduler, as in "ignore motion during regular activity hours but pay attention during this period when we don't expect much to be going on." Our intended target is figuring out how raccoons are getting into the barn so that we can prevent them from getting into the barn, and we need to extend our internet up there before we can use the camera for that.  Wish us luck!

Reviews.Title: GREAT product for those with a little networking knowledge
Reviews.Author: Jeff Robinson
Reviews.Content: I found the install/setup process a little clunky compared to brand-name cameras (Linksys, etc...), but overall it wasn't too bad. I ran the install software as instructed, referenced my wireless router user guide a few times to brush-up on my port-forwarding settings, and within a little over an hour I was viewing live video on my smartphone (after downloading a third-party IP Cam app).In short, I'm impressed with what I got for my money. The color is a little off (my brown sofas show-up as purple), but I'm not terribly concerned about getting just the right hue.If you're in the market for a budget-friendly IP camera that works, and you're willing to spend an extra 10-15 minutes on setting it up, this is the right product.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like!  It has good picture quality and is smooth on the frame rate.  The web page interface has a couple buttons for 'invert' and mirror picture, which have enough latency to suggest that the cam itself does these functions.Cam is only about 6oz, and does not get hot when plugged in.  Motors for movement are silent.The enclosed CD actually does something useful (gasp)!  Normally the CD on an internet appliance is useless, but this has a little program that figures out which IP on your network belongs to the cam.  If wanted I think you could skip the CD part though.The night vision is surprisingly good (I have never used night vision before).  Its pretty much like daytime but in black/white.  The WIFI works pretty smooth, have not tried the advanced stuff like ftp, motion alarm and auto DDNS.Now this thing is going in my attic and I will get a look at the dang squirrel that has moved in.

Reviews.Title: Astonishing value
Reviews.Author: Neil Griffiths
Reviews.Content: Got one of these cameras to monitor my dogs.Couldn't be simpler to set up (some of the UI spelling is a bit wonky though).Works great with DynDNS and cable modem. Only two workable problems;- Delay in a bit high when panning and tilting the camera remotely.- Occasionally on my W7 laptop (but not a W7 tower) the activeX component causes a hard crash.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: schendw
Reviews.Content: This product does exactly what they say it does. I don't think you can beat this for the price. One word of advice though... if you get your internet through Clear wire and use an Air port wireless router you will need to port forward through both devices to access from outside your personal network. I keep coming up with reasons to justify this to my wife... security, watch the dog, nanny cam, extra baby monitor, and a cool way to scare unknowing guests. The speaker is very loud!

Reviews.Title: Very effecive and affordable
Reviews.Author: Outside Range
Reviews.Content: We have worked with two devices for a couple of years and they have been great.  The instructions for setting up DYNDNS are wrong but the DYNDNS website will guide you well.

Reviews.Title: Few things you should know
Reviews.Author: goofyfoot
Reviews.Content: The set up is as follows:Plug the network cable into the camera and then into your router.run ipcamera.exe out of the windows directory on the dvd (if you are on a PC)Select the camera when it comes up.This will open your browser so you can configure the wireless.Click on wireless config and scan for your wireless routerpick your wireless router and then enter the SSID (mine is NSASUCKS)  and also your password (mine is...only known by me and the NSA I'm sure)Hit submit.  Then go back to the ipcamera.exe you ran before the webpage the ip address you see there is now the one you will use to connect your browser to the camera.To view remotely I suggest ispyconnect.com for eight bucks a month.  They now have it working great and works on my phone, tablet and PC's.ABOUT THE CAMERAPicture isn't all that good at least at night.  Very pixelated but for the price, probably not bad.  The recordings are better than what you see live.The ZOOM - It's fake.  It's just a digital zoom which you will never use because it is digital.Voice - not audible unless you have your ear to this thing.  In Ispy I type and it is converted to speech so once again, useless.All in all, good enough.  Not great.  I won't upgrade the firmware because it's working.  Also there is nothing that a firmware update could really do for me at this point I don' t think.. More later!

Reviews.Title: Great features for the price.
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Received Mod# Fi8918W  I consider this a bonus.Setup: Mounted inside large picture window covering my front yard, Sidewalk and drive. ( Used the flip and mirror features)I've been a Sys Admin for 15 years so I really won't be able to say much about setup difficulty.I was able to get all features working within about 2-3 hours without the provided software. This includes:E mail (Gmail) FTP(Seagate NAS in my basement)I sacrificed the night vision knowingly placing it in the window( It will reflect) I have a street light in front of my house and the camera is able see just fine out to the street.Upgrade the firmware first thing after you connect it to the LAN. The new user interface is much better than the one it came with.This camera works great and has many features  for the price.  I will work with this for a couple weeks and may purchase  another one.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F 18918W
Reviews.Author: BG
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera and works great from anywhere great support from Foscam and tech support agent Andrew. I plan on buying one more

Reviews.Title: ok video quality...still Standard Def.
Reviews.Author: Dave S. "SonicOrbStudios"
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Compact, light weight, quiet and smooth P/T motor- Easy setup via the web - Plenty of help video on the Foscam website.- Price - Can't really complain as it's very low in price...- Powerful night vision IR blaster - This set of IR blasters on the front can be switched on or off on the web controls but only turn on in darker locations with the help of the light detector switch up front. Plenty happy with how well this sees at night!- Manual focus - It's nice to have but can only be set at the cam...and works well enough.Cons:- Lacking help files for port forwarding - I found their help files to be lacking when showing how to set things to be able to port forward and access the camera from any public wifi location.  My verizon fios router has a much different port forward screen from the one they show.- Colors are quite a bit off - This is due to the lack of an IR filter built into the camera lens to help it see at night with the use of the IR blasters.  Greens look a bit bland and reds look purple.  Later models had a switch on software installed to bypass this.- Random dropouts - I run this almost 12 hours a day on my desktop and maybe 3 times I see it crash and have to refresh...not a huge issue but still a bit annoying.  I am not sure what the source of this crash is but guessing the video plugin running on the desktop...(flash or whatever)- Manual focus - Can't adjust from anywhere...but it worksOverall, I would tend to save up and get the newer HD model to get better framerates, and above all, video quality.  I've seen compared videos on YouTube and this new HD model (FI9821W) is just well worth the added price)I however don't need quality, just the ability to see when the UPS or FedEx truck rolls up...I can have a friend help with the port forwarding as it's just a matter of figuring out how to do it on my particular router.  I'll make a tutorial on this on the SonicOrbStudios YouTube channel when I'm shown how to do it myself.

Reviews.Title: Works Great by not good color.
Reviews.Author: R. Michael Frank
Reviews.Content: It works great. It was hard to set up WIFI and takes a long time, when it is set up, to connect sometimes.  The "Color" picture makes my yard look like all the grass is dead - the color is off slightly.

Reviews.Title: Works, but keeps on resetting itself every few days
Reviews.Author: Jattin Dudakia
Reviews.Content: Works great except when it resets itself. The the view gets moved and have to readjust. It looses connection with the wireless router and then reestablishes it.

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: macman27
Reviews.Content: The camera works well. The image quality is great. The software needs some work. Recording software isn't included making the need to purchase third party software and adding to the cost

Reviews.Title: Great Webcam!
Reviews.Author: W. Mills
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great webcam that is easy to use.I bought this webcam to track how often my wife sleep walks at night.  With the night vision, motion detection, programmable motion detection times, and FTP image upload it is perfect.  I consider myself a "techy" type of person so I didn't have any issues with configuration.  I also have my own domain with web space and FTP access.  You could probably run a simple FTP server on a local computer and have the images transferred to that local computer.  The motion sensitivity is adjustable (1-10), by default it was set on 8 and picked up way too much of us moving in our sleep.  We finally settled on 5, it gets the larger movements in our sleep and every time my wife sleep walks.The motion detection is programmable on a per day basis on 15 minute increments.  This makes for a nice visual display for when images are uploaded.The pan, tilt, and zoom feature is really nice.  This thing is so quiet when it moves, our dogs can't even hear it.  The built in speaker and microphone are average at best but they do work.  The speaker can sometimes have a little echo.  Which really freaked my dog out the first time I tried to talk to them.I would have given it 5 stars but it does lockup when viewing the feed with a desktop computer and web browser for long periods of time.  It then has to be manually restarted which is a pain.  Camera works flawlessly when using the Android app tinyCam.  All the features of the camera can be controlled using this app.If you want to use this camera over your broadband connection you need to be familiar with opening ports on your router and assigning an internal static IP address to the camera.  It does have a Universal Plug and Play feature but I did not use it so I can't speak to how well it works.

Reviews.Title: better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Chris Swiontek
Reviews.Content: i actually ordered a 08w,not a 18w{witch i recieved, but im not complaining ! =)the f18908w is a great cam {for indoor} adding to an existing foscam settup. works great with blue iris too.now....the f18918w is an even better camera! you can manually disable the night vision ir lights {the f18908w cant}i got this to have an extra one on hand,but since i got a f18918w instead,i will use it for an outdoor dome enclosure now!{since i can disable the ir lights on this one=)thank you sooooooo much !

Reviews.Title: Works better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Gigg
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, works perfectly with my synology diskstation! I can watch my house from my cellphone now, it just works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: GREAT IPCamera
Reviews.Author: Ronald Webcams
Reviews.Content: The camera works OK, the first one of this kind. Great options with only one problem as I ordered the wrongs IPCamera. I need them in true colors. The next one will be the F18910W. I recommended this camera for any reason and I use them around the house.

Reviews.Title: Works good at first, but goes down hill fast
Reviews.Author: shmich
Reviews.Content: This product worked good at first.  Easy set up if you are familiar with networking.  I could see set up being difficult if you don't have any prior experience.  Audio quality is horrendous with constant chopping sound.  After a month, the camera needs to be reset multiple times a day as it is inaccessible.

Reviews.Title: Works okay,
Reviews.Author: Misty D. Johnson
Reviews.Content: It often resets, and turns on the NV w/o any warning. That blinds my camera because it's behind glass. No telling when it's just going to freeze up.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: R. George "Tha Leprechaun"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera hooked up in my house where I can view the inside of my living room but also can turn the camera to view if someone or something is outside of the front door.  I use it to see if packages have arrived yet and also to see if my pets are behaving while I am at work.I got the iphone app for $5 and I can control pan and tilt from the phone.  Also can record video and take pictures straight to the iphone remotely.  Excellent product.  I will probably buy more

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. K. Schrock "kelly"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. It works well. The night vision actually works. The range of motion is good. It did seem like the audio, when turned on, slowed things down a bit, but I'll have to experiment with it some more to see if I can do something to make it work better.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Home Use
Reviews.Author: azcoyotedog
Reviews.Content: A few days after my wife and I adopted a puppy from the local dog pound, we decided to purchase this webcam so we can keep an eye on our puppy who, while we were not home, liked to chew more things than just his dog bone?This webcam was very easy to set up. You just connect it to your home wireless network router and follow the instructions included on the CD. Once it's correctly setup, you can mount it anywhere you want as long as its within the range of your wireless network.Not only can you watch your webcam on your home PC, but you can watch it on ANY PC, anywhere in the world (Internet Access Required of course). You can also watch your webcam on your Smartphone by purchasing any of the Apps that are available.The webcam can pan left to right and up and down, you can even use the available function buttons that, once setup, you can pan and/or tilt the webcam to any position with the push of one button. Depending on the Smartphone App, you may have up to 11 presets? The only thing this webcam can't do is zoom in or out, but again, depending on the Smartphone App, you can pinch & zoom the image which works just as good.The webcam also has infrared lighting so you can see the image on the webcam in darkness or very low lighting. The PC software and the Smartphone Apps give you many other types of setups so you can customize you webcam viewing. Overall, this Foscam webcam works so well, I ended up buying two.... and I'll be buying a 3rd webcam soon!I'm very happy with this product so I give it 5 out of 5 stars! (even if it doesn't offer zoom)

Reviews.Content: This is my first security camera and I am impressed.  It was an easy setup thru my LAN cable.  Once setup with my wireless network, it was perfect.  I have it set as an home video camera for security and day/night it works good for my use.  It is clear enough for home use at 25 feet.  Pans, tilts, scans left-right or up down.  Easy WebUi interface thru IE8.  I have no complaints from this for the price or ease of use.  I would like them to make an Outdoor model of this.  I have not found one yet.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value
Reviews.Author: Douglas R. Hofstetter
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a few different wifi "Netcam" brands. This one was by far the easiest to setup and has the most features for the dollar that I have ever encountered. I set it up on a computer running Windows XP, MS Internet Explorer and a Netgear (N) router. Once camera was initially setup to work on a laptop, I also downloaded the iPad2 app and there was no setup at all for that...it just worked locally and remotely. Details: Like all wireless devices it gets a bit complicated if you want a secure Internet setup. In my opinion the manual in places, requires advanced home network knowledge. It has been translated from Chinese to English and some of the language (Sentence structure) is confusing due to that. If you are not afraid to wander off your default router settings, you will be able to setup a very secure internet camera to meet your very specific and secure needs. If use is limited to a local network its quite plug and play for basic needs and needs very minimal setup. Strengths: Being able to transmit your voice and listening while viewing remotely is a real plus. Microphone is pretty sensitive as well. Infrared seems a little dark but I am impressed with sensitivity and range. Weaknesses: Internal use only unless protected from the elements. Must have a router that handles  802.11 b/g at a minimum, 802.11 b/g is old protocol standard and has limited range and older security protocols, Need to understand how to setup a domain using one of the free service providers for remote(WAN)Internet use like dynds.org. Overall, great buy, great product. Wish it ran on batteries rather than AC.

Reviews.Title: All in all a good buy
Reviews.Author: Ricky Davis
Reviews.Content: I've had a few minor ishues with this camera, but all in all I think its a good buy and would buy another one in a minuit. It works on my IPad but its tricky to learn to move it around on it or my phone. The audio for the device has never worked for me but to tell the truth I havent really tried that hard to get it to work.

The bootleggers have become increasinlgy proficient in duplicating the physical appearance of our cameras as well as the user interface. Thus, we can no longer provide support or warranties on behalf of ANY Amazon or Ebay resellers, whatsoever. Please protect yourself and purchase direclty using the links on this page. If you have any questions or concerns please call us directly at 713 893 7869. All returns and replacements are processed through our warehouse in Houston, TX. "Caveat Emptor.

Reviews.Author: awest
Reviews.Content: It took us three weeks to finally get this product up and working... Had to hire an IT person.  If you don't order directly from manufacturer you get no technical support. Now that it is all hooked up we have router problems, it randomly resets itself.  Once I find a different alternative, I'll change.

Reviews.Title: Worst Customer Service Ever
Reviews.Author: B. Hayes "BHP"
Reviews.Content: I have bought many items over Amazon through the years but this company has to be the worst customer service I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. I bought two of these units and configured them in under 15 minutes. They are easy to configure, you simply plug in the camera with an ethernet cable then using the IP Camera tool you configure the wireless network settings. I configured the first one with no problems but the second unit would not even see my wireless network. This eliminates the possibility that I was doing something wrong. The second unit was defective, I contacted Foscam via email and they agreed to RMA the product. The very next day I had an emergency that I had to travel out of state because my mom was in the hospital. To make a long story short I was out of town for quite a while. When I returned I attempted to exchange the camera as agreed on by Foscam's rep. I was told that after 30 days I could not exchange it even though I was given an RMA number to do so. I just wanted to confirm that upon receipt of my defective unit I would be given credit to purchase another. They refused to answer my emails after 3 times of refusing to refund a defective unit. I have the RMA number but am afraid to ship the unit back in fear they won't credit me anyhow and I'll just be out the $89 I paid for the unit plus shipping on top of that. The cameras (well the ONE that works) are fair at a close distance, anything beyond 10 feet isn't too clear. Not much else to say other than how displeased I am with the lack of them holding up to exchanging the unit. Would not recommend this company to anyone considering a wireless security camera.
